did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Files of Barber Conable, generated during his tenure as New York State Senator and United States Congressman. Also, a narrative account of his experiences with the World Bank.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Barber B. Conable (b.1922) graduated from Cornell University in 1942, and was a Republican congressman representing the 37th Congressional District, New York in the U.S. House of Representatives until his retirement in 1985. He served as a New York senator, 1963-1964, before being elected to the 89th Congress.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Files of Barber Conable, generated during his tenure as New York State Senator and United States Congressman. Also, a narrative account of his experiences with the World Bank.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: All files, except case files, are closed for ten years from the initiation of the file except with written permission of the donor.
Case files are closed for thirty years from the initiation of the file except by written permission of the donor.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Barber Conable papers, #2794. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

p.extref: A copy of the printed guide is available by clicking here. This covers only a portion of the collection. (1 MB Searchable PDF)
